home I've spent a lot of my life on the
front lines organizing protesting
marching to defend my community from the
impacts of the fossil fuel
industry soon the US government for
violating our constitutional rights to a
stable climate speaking that the United
Nations have played a bunch of different
roles in those spaces and it means a lot
to get to be here to tell these stories
through our art through our
music music has such a IR refutable
power to connect people across the globe
and for me this art is so personal it's
such a reflection of who I am of my
community of where I come from of the
reverence that I hold for all those that
have laid the foundation that have laid
the groundwork for what this art form is
all of the black artists that have not
only proliferated the culture of Hip Hop
to touch every corner of the globe but
have stewarded it as a tool for
Liberation for oppressed and colonized
people all across the planet to bring
light to bring hope to bring these
stories to the Forefront and as our
relationship with the land and with the
Earth must be one of reciprocity our
relationship with culture must also
reflect that I stand before y'all as an
embodiment of all those that have come
before my before me me
anad my ancestors my family my community
my people we are a matriarchal society
and we were
artists and it's because of that
struggle
that my ancestors my great-grandmother
Abita hulita those that came before me
the women that held the small pieces of
our culture the fragments that were left
over despite 500 years of colonization
that were passed down onto me that's the
reason I get to stand on this stage and
carry my name and carry my language and
carry their stories so to be a vessel
for their stories and to be a vessel for
the stories that are still being told in
our continued struggle for Liberation
and our continued struggle for
decolonization and our continued
struggle to preserve our life ways so
that these lands can continue to be
abundant for generations to follow that
is what this art represents for
